addRelayerForChain(address,uint256).details: this can only be executed by the FEE_MANAGER_ROLE, which is the DAO and the owner

deployFeesWithCeler().details: Once the queue of the fee manager is filled with configs, it'll be processable. It creates an array of dtos which are being processed by the target chain and its relayer.

removeRelayerOnChain(uint256).details: this can only be executed by the FEE_MANAGER_ROLE, which is the DAO and the owner

sendFeesWithCeler(uint32,address).details: The bounty receiver is set because you can't relay on the initiator in the consuming      contract on the home chain, because contracts can execute this method without having      the same address on the home chain. It also transfers the tokens to the relayer which      then bridges the tokens and sends the message to the CELER IM service

params._bountyReceiver: address of the bounty receiver on the home chain
params.minMaxSlippage: external defined minimal max slippage by the estimation api of CELER

updateRelayerOnChain(address,uint256).details: this can only be executed by the FEE_MANAGER_ROLE, which is the DAO and the owner

addRelayerForChain(address,uint256).notice: Adds a relayer for a specific chain id

deployFeesWithCeler().notice: This method deploys added, updated or removed fee configuration to desired chains through CELER IM. It is executable by everyone (DeFi things obv)

deployFeesWithCelerConfirm(uint64,bytes).notice: Registers the successful deployment of the fees to the given chain

removeRelayerOnChain(uint256).notice: Removes a relayer for a specific chain id

sendFeesWithCeler(uint32,address).notice: Sends fees stored on the FeeStore back to the home chain, respecting a bounty receiverCan be executed by everyone. Its success is dependend on the sendFeesThreshold being met

updateDeployFeesWei(uint256).notice: Sets the amount of fees that is being used to initiate the deploy fees process

updateRelayerOnChain(address,uint256).notice: Updates a relayer for a specific chain id

updateSendFeesThreshold(uint256).notice: Sets the threshold a total fee can be sent to the home chain

updateSendFeesWei(uint256).notice: Sets the amount of fees that is being used to initiate the send fees process

userdoc.notice: This contract provides the functionality to interact with the celer services through a defined relayer
